intro: Borbonia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered borbonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
